alert.note: Alert for Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 10 at 10:49AM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Minnesota...Wisconsin... Mississippi River at Wabasha affecting Wabasha and Buffalo Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is expected to begin later this week. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Wabasha. * WHEN...From Friday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.4 feet, Flooding begins near East Main Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Monday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening.
